rationales.power: Wei-Lin asserts his former managerial competence and resents being treated as if he knows nothing, revealing deep concern with status and recognition of his authority.

rationales.self_direction: Wei-Lin has strategically mapped out restaurant pickup times and optimized his routes, demonstrating independent problem-solving and initiative in his work.
rationales.hedonism: He takes the undesirable late-night shifts ending at 2 AM and forces himself to maintain a constant smile for the Diamond Driver rating, sacrificing personal comfort for income.
rationales.achievement: He tracks his rating at 4.92 and pursues the Diamond Driver program, setting concrete performance goals to gain priority order access.
rationales.security: He monitors the family savings carefully, calculating they have three to four months of reserves, and takes extra shifts preemptively against his wife's potential hour cuts.
rationales.conformity: He maintains high customer-facing performance (keeping the smile on) and follows the app's rating system requirements despite the personal cost.
rationales.benevolence: Wei-Lin takes the worst shifts nobody wants to ensure financial stability for his family, acting to protect his wife and son's welfare.

rationales.self_direction: Wei-Lin reframes his situation as adaptation rather than failure, asserting his own narrative against his brother's condescension and his son's suggestions to explore other options.
rationales.power: He acutely feels the loss of status, aware that his brother looks down on his gig work and his son may respect him less since the career change.
rationales.security: He insists on doing what needs to be done to keep the family running, prioritizing household stability despite the career upheaval.
rationales.conformity: Wei-Lin pushes back against his brother's implicit judgment, refusing to accept the social expectation that his current job represents failure.
rationales.benevolence: He frames his entire effort as keeping the family afloat, refusing to apologize for doing whatever is necessary for his wife and son.

rationales.achievement: Three weeks of perfect service ratings were erased by one unfair review, undermining his concrete progress toward the Diamond Driver goal.
rationales.power: A customer dismissed his explanation with 'whatever' and shut the door, leaving him powerless to defend himself against an unjust rating.
rationales.security: His rating dropped to 4.88, jeopardizing the Diamond Driver threshold he needs for consistent income and financial stability.

rationales.self_direction: Wei-Lin distinguishes himself from Mr. Huang, who pretended not to recognize him, asserting that at least he is not the one hiding from reality.
rationales.hedonism: He worked from 11 AM to midnight with a hurting back, delaying the scooter seat replacement to save money, sacrificing personal comfort entirely.
rationales.achievement: He logged a full thirteen-hour workday and earned NT$2,800, demonstrating persistence in pursuing income targets despite physical pain.
rationales.power: Wei-Lin contrasts himself favorably with his former colleague Mr. Huang who hid from him, reclaiming a sense of dignity by refusing to be ashamed of his work.
rationales.security: He avoids spending NT$1,500 on the scooter seat despite his back pain, prioritizing financial reserves over immediate comfort.

rationales.self_direction: He chose to work on Christmas because of surge pricing, making an independent strategic decision about how to spend the holiday based on his own calculus.
rationales.hedonism: Wei-Lin sits outside in the cold rather than inside where it's warm, waiting for deliveries on Christmas instead of enjoying the holiday dinner his wife prepared.
rationales.achievement: He capitalizes on Christmas surge pricing while most drivers take the day off, demonstrating competitive drive and work ethic.
rationales.security: He works the holiday specifically because the surge pricing and reduced competition mean more reliable and higher income.
rationales.tradition: He works through Christmas instead of spending it with his wife, breaking from the holiday tradition of family togetherness.
rationales.benevolence: His wife made dinner and set one place setting, texting to ask when he would come home, but he chose to keep working, neglecting the relationship.
He arrived home late to find his wife had already gone to bed silently after putting everything in the fridge, revealing the cost of his absence on their relationship.

rationales.power: Being called 'Uncle' and tipped NT$100 by a young man in an expensive apartment underscored Wei-Lin's loss of status, reducing him to someone who receives charity from those half his age.
rationales.conformity: When the young customer offered the tip and the well-meaning but patronizing comment, Wei-Lin said thank you and accepted it graciously rather than expressing his discomfort.
rationales.benevolence: Upon hearing his son got a research assistant job, Wei-Lin told him to focus on his studies and not worry about money, prioritizing his son's wellbeing despite their financial strain.

rationales.achievement: Wei-Lin achieved Diamond Driver status by maintaining a 4.91 rating for two months, reaching a concrete performance milestone he had been working toward.
rationales.power: Earning Diamond status and priority orders represents a form of rank and recognition within the gig platform hierarchy.
rationales.security: Diamond Driver status means more consistent orders, and his wife's hours were not cut after all, both stabilizing the family's financial situation.
